title: Cloudy Days: Giant Softbox
description: A quick win: understand Cloudy Days: Giant Softbox.

hook.text: Photographers love overcast days. The entire sky becomes a diffusion panel. No harsh shadows anywhere.

buildup.text: Clouds scatter direct sunlight into soft, even illumination that wraps around subjects from every direction.

discovery.text: Colors appear more saturated on cloudy days because there are no bright highlights to wash them out.

twist.text: The flat light can lack drama. The trick is adding direction â€” use a wall or tree to block light from one side.

climax.text: Overcast light is forgiving, reliable, and consistent. Perfect for learning and practicing portraiture.

quiz.question: Why do colors look more saturated on overcast days?
options: No bright highlights wash out the colors
